title: Augusta County: John Marshall McCue to J.D. Imboden, July 22, 1856
summary: John Marshall McCue writes to J.D. Imboden, requesting that he respond to a recent communication and also send a copy of the Spectator, and telling about an artist who was recently sketching the town as well as Harrisonburg, and about a horseback journey undertaken by two young friends, Allen Trimble Thompson and Samuel Hubben, Jr., who were studying for the ministry.
